descriptions: No attempt or completely incorrect prime factorization.
Demonstrates minimal understanding of prime factorization; attempts to find factors but with significant errors.
Identifies some prime factors, but the final expression is incomplete or contains composite numbers.
Expresses the number as a product of factors, but there are some errors in identifying all prime factors or in the final expression.
Expresses the number as a product of its prime factors with only minor errors or omissions.
Accurately expresses the whole number as a product of its prime factors, demonstrating a clear and complete understanding of the concept.
Work is disorganized and difficult to follow; no clear steps shown.
Shows some attempt to organize work, but it is still difficult to follow the process.
Work is somewhat organized; some steps are shown, but may be unclear or missing explanations.
Work is generally organized with most steps shown, but some explanations may be lacking.
Work is clearly organized and easy to follow; all steps are shown with clear explanations.
Work is exceptionally clear, organized, and easy to follow; includes detailed steps and explanations, demonstrating a thorough understanding.
No recognition of the application of prime factorization.
Attempts to apply prime factorization but struggles with the concept.
Applies prime factorization with limited success.
Demonstrates an understanding of prime factorization by applying it.
Effectively applies prime factorization, demonstrating a clear grasp of the concept.
Skillfully applies prime factorization with a high degree of accuracy.
